intro: Thliphthisa gorganica, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually blue-gray in color, and it produces small, white to pale blue flowers. Thliphthisa gorganica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
